normalised: **Environmental News: Mumbai Tackles Mountains of Waste, One Gully at a Time**

unnormalised: Mumbai, the city that never sleeps (or stops generating waste!), is stepping up its waste management game. The BMC (Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation) announced a new initiative on 15/08/2024, focusing on source segregation and decentralized composting. Remember how our grandmothers always composted vegetable peels? It's that, but on a larger, more organized scale!
normalised: Mumbai, the city that never sleeps (or stops generating waste!), is stepping up its waste management game. The B M C (Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation) announced a new initiative on fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four, focusing on source segregation and decentralized composting. Remember how our grandmothers always composted vegetable peels? It's that, but on a larger, more organized scale!

unnormalised: The project, dubbed "Swachh Mumbai, Sundar Mumbai," aims to reduce the amount of garbage reaching the Deonar and Mulund dumping grounds, which are already overflowing. Imagine, those literal mountains of waste!
normalised: The project, dubbed "Swachh Mumbai, Sundar Mumbai," aims to reduce the amount of garbage reaching the Deonar and Mulund dumping grounds, which are already overflowing. Imagine, those literal mountains of waste!

unnormalised: The BMC plans to distribute color-coded bins to households and conduct awareness drives, especially in densely populated areas like Dharavi and Kurla. At 09:00 hrs tomorrow, officials are holding a mohalla meeting in Juhu to explain the new rules. Failure to segregate waste could result in fines, starting Jan 1, 2025. Experts from IIT Bombay are also collaborating on the project, offering technical assistance and exploring innovative waste-to-energy solutions. This initiative could potentially clean up not just Mumbai, but also provide a blueprint for other Indian cities grappling with similar waste woes. Every little bit, from our kitchen scraps to that discarded Diwali decoration, matters in this massive cleanup effort! A similar campaign, according to reports dated 12/10/2023, saw moderate success in Pune.
